result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian James Daniels was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
On Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to 12 months jail, with Huber, without electronic monitoring, the Court STAYS this sentence and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years.
Judgment of Conviction to indicate: "ALCOHOL TREATMENT COURT PARTICIPANT"

miscConds.notes:
--Comply with ALL conditions of Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court

--Victim impact panel attendance

--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores

--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's License and Agent Approval

--absolute sobriety

--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent

--submit DNA sample upon demand

--6 demerit points assessed

--To pay fine of $2400 + costs, The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in  20 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.

timeConds.notes:
--To serve 60 total days conditional jail, to be served as follows: 60  days on SCRAM CAM (as approved by the MOU signed by the Jefferson County Sheriff) ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order) Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings

**Mr. Daniels confirms that he understands he will need to serve 48 hours in custody, forthwith; Wis. Stat. 346.65(7) is cited. 

**Defendant allowed one 24-hour, furlough during the initial period of conditional jail for a religious or nationally recognized holiday. That 24 hour period will not count as time spent serving the sentence, and instead the period of conditional jail will end 24 hours later that it otherwise would have. During the furlough, the Defendant will be required to remain absolutely sober. A SCRAM monitoring device will be installed and active during that 24 hour period. The Defendant will be required to submit to a urine screen for drugs and alcohol immediately upon returning to the jail. At least 10 days notice of the potential furlough needs to be given to the jail and WCS so appropriate arrangements can be made

--300 days (10 months) condition time Imposed and Stayed. This additional conditional jail time can be used at the discretion of the treatment court judge or his designee for sanctions. If the defendant completes treatment court, any remaining conditional jail time will be permanently stayed. However, if the defendant is removed from treatment court, this conditional jail time shall be served.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: mailed to Defendant w/ JOC (7/27/22--ma)
with Elements and CCS attached

[ma] Case called at 3:20 PM 
Defendant Brian James Daniels in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Brian James Daniels.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Maximum penalties recited. 
recess: 3:26pm--reconvene: 3:40pm [to allow Atty De La Rosa and Mr. Daniels to have discussion about 48 hours in custody conditional jail time requirement, despite SCRAM CAM being ordered]

Mr. Daniels confirms that he understands he will need to serve 48 hours in custody, forthwith; Wis. Stat. 346.65(7) is cited. 

Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing arguments/recommendations given by Counsel

On Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to 12 months jail, with Huber, without electronic monitoring, the Court STAYS this sentence and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

 --To serve 60 total days conditional jail, to be served as follows: 60  days on SCRAM CAM (as approved by the MOU signed by the Jefferson County Sheriff) ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order) Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings
**Defendant allowed one 24-hour, furlough during the initial period of conditional jail for a religious or nationally recognized holiday. That 24 hour period will not count as time spent serving the sentence, and instead the period of conditional jail will end 24 hours later that it otherwise would have. During the furlough, the Defendant will be required to remain absolutely sober. A SCRAM monitoring device will be installed and active during that 24 hour period. The Defendant will be required to submit to a urine screen for drugs and alcohol immediately upon returning to the jail. At least 10 days notice of the potential furlough needs to be given to the jail and WCS so appropriate arrangements can be made

--300 days (10 months) condition time Imposed and Stayed. This additional conditional jail time can be used at the discretion of the treatment court judge or his designee for sanctions. If the defendant completes treatment court, any remaining conditional jail time will be permanently stayed. However, if the defendant is removed from treatment court, this conditional jail time shall be served. 

--Comply with ALL conditions of Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's License and Agent Approval
--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--submit DNA sample upon demand 
--To pay fine of $2400 + costs, The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in  20 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.   

The Court orders outright: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Judgment of Conviction to indicate: "ALCOHOL TREATMENT COURT PARTICIPANT" 

70 days sentence credit.
recess: 4:01pm

Defendant Brian J. Daniels in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Shock appear for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 2:34pm 
Defendant Brian J. Daniels in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa reports that the parties are well into negotiations; admission into Treatment Court is being pursued. Attorney De La Rosa proposes the scheduling of a preliminary hearing as soon as possible. recess 2:37pm 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing (likely waiver) on June 17th at 2:30pm --Mr. Daniels remains in the Jail on the cash bail requirement

Amended Bond. Condition of Bond include: 
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--Mr. Daniels is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.   **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

[MK] case called at 1:15pm 
Defendant Brian J. Daniels does not appear. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
J. Reinke from WCS is present by telephone.  
The Court will re-call the case at the 2:00pm hearing time that was announced in court earlier this week.  
reconvene 2:32pm.  Mr. Daniels now appears.  
After hearings arguments on the State's 5/17/22 Motion to Modify Bond, the Court modifies the Signature Bond to a $250 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered.
